spanishExample: ¡Deje de hacer eso! Esas personas estarán aquí pronto.
englishTranslation: (formal) Stop doing that! Those people will be here soon.
vocabIncluded: deje: stop/leave/allow, he/she/it stop/leave/allow (Dejar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
estarán: "will be", "they will be" (Estar, future, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¡Espera! No dejes tus cosas en cualquier lado.
englishTranslation: Wait! Don’t leave your things in any place.
vocabIncluded: dejes: stop/leave/allow, you stop/leave/allow(Dejar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Espero que lo haga igual o peor que yo!
englishTranslation: I hope she does it the same or worse than me!
vocabIncluded: "o": "or" when used between items in a list
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
espero:  hope/wait/expect, I  hope/wait/expect  (Esperar, present, 1st person)
igual: in the same way / equally (adverb)

spanishExample: ¿Cuánto tiempo la esperas?
englishTranslation: How much time do you wait for her?
vocabIncluded: cuánto: adverb meaning "how much?" in a question or implied question
esperas:  hope/wait/expect, you  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Dejé de hablar alto porque hablaba igual que él.
englishTranslation: I stopped talking loud because I spoke the same as he.
vocabIncluded: dejé: stopped/left/allowed, I stopped/left/allowed (Dejar, preterite, 1st person)
hablaba: was speaking, I was speaking (Hablar, imperfect, 1st person)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
igual: in the same way / equally (adverb)

spanishExample: El lugar es medio seguro. No va a pasar nada si lo hacemos rápido.
englishTranslation: The place is kind of safe. Nothing is going to happen if we do it fast.
vocabIncluded: seguro: adjective meaning "safe" or "secure" when used with Ser
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Esa persona no es nada seria y jamás dice la verdad.
englishTranslation: That person isn’t at all serious and never tells the truth.

spanishExample: Están bastante cerca de la casa y van a hablar acerca de eso.
englishTranslation: They're pretty near the house and they’re going to talk about that.
vocabIncluded: hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Están esperando que él haga lo que ella dejó de hacer.
englishTranslation: They’re waiting for him to do what she stopped doing.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
dejó: stopped/left/allowed, he/she/it   stopped/left/allowed (Dejar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Estaremos ahí pronto porque ellos jamás están ahí a tiempo.
englishTranslation: We will be there soon because they are never there on time.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
estaremos: "will be", "we will be" (Estar, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Ha dejado de hablar alto justo después de verla.
englishTranslation: He has stopped talking loudly just after seeing her.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)

spanishExample: Esperan ahora para ver qué dice.
englishTranslation: They’re waiting now in order to see what she says.
vocabIncluded: "qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
esperan:  hope/wait/expect, they  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 3rd person plural)
para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: Lo esperaba todos los días a la misma hora.
englishTranslation: I waited for him every day at the same time.
vocabIncluded: esperaba: hoped/waited/expected, I hoped/waited/expected (Esperar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Lo esperaba todos los días en el mismo lugar.
englishTranslation: I was waiting for him every day in the same place.
vocabIncluded: esperaba: hoped/waited/expected, I hoped/waited/expected (Esperar, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Lo esperamos porque dejamos nuestras cosas en su casa.
englishTranslation: We’re waiting for him because we left our things in his house.
vocabIncluded: dejamos: stopped/left/allowed, we __ (Dejar, preterite, 1st person plural)
esperamos:  hope/wait/expect, we  hope/wait/expect (Esperar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Lo hicimos rápido, justo antes de que ellos lo pudieran ver.
englishTranslation: We did it fast, just before they were able to see it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pudieran: "were able", "they were able" (Poder, subjunctive past, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Me deja ir porque está medio cerca.
englishTranslation: She lets me go because it’s kind of near.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
deja: stop/leave/allow, he/she/it stop/leave/allow (Dejar, present, 3rd person)
dejar ir: to let go of (idiom)

spanishExample: No está nada feliz, ¿no ves que habla muy bajo?
englishTranslation: He isn’t at all happy, don’t you see that he speaks very quietly?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
habla: speaks, he/she/it speaks (Hablar, present, 3rd person)
ves: see, you see (Ver, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Primero tenemos que hablar acerca de él porque está bastante solo.
englishTranslation: First we have to talk about him because he’s pretty lonely.
vocabIncluded: hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Si dejas de hacer eso, ellos lo harán peor.
englishTranslation: If you stop doing that, they will do it worse.
vocabIncluded: dejas: stop/leave/allow, you stop/leave/allow (Dejar, present, 2nd person)
harán: __, they will __ (Hacer, future, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Tienes que hablar bajo si quieres hablar primero.
englishTranslation: You have to speak quietly if you want to talk first.
vocabIncluded: hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation
